subject: Re: [junit] HTML Testrunner
msgSnippet: ... Sure, publish it in the Files section of the group.  If anyone is truly interested they will grab it.  I would suggest putting it in some archive format
messageBody:
On 09/27/2005 04:22 AM, Andrew Wilson apparently said:

> Hi,
>
> Ive written an HTML JUnit test runner. Like the text runner, but
> generates HTML. Obviously, this is implemented by the ANT tasks but,
> since we use a make build, this isnt terribly useful to me. Its
> prototype code at the moment, but it works. Ive implemented
> TestListener. My columns currently include:
>
> - Test name
> - Output (with stderr coloured differently to stdout)
> - Problem (ie. Exception or Assert)
> - Time
> - Memory delta
>
> I use Velocity to do the formatting and stick some summary data at the
> top.
>
> Has anyone else done one of these? Is anyone else interested? Should
> I publish the code?

Sure, publish it in the Files section of the group. If anyone is truly
interested they will grab it. I would suggest putting it in some
archive format (jar/zip, tar, etc.) with whatever documentation is
needed to get one up and running. Make sure to include the version
numbers of 3rd party libs you are using.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
